CIView

CIView is CIP’s generic visual component.  It combines almost every other foundation class.  Extends CIObject.

Properties

frameCIRect.  The dimensions of the view.
subviews<Array>.  Other CIViews inside of this view that are updated by this view (their superview).
styleCIStyle.  The style rules for this view.
resizableBoolean.  Whether this view is affected when the window is resized.  Use with caution as resizing is an expensive operation!
Summary

Functions

initialize(configuration)

initialize: function(configuration)

Configuration

frameCIRect.  The dimensions of the view.  Defaults to new CIRect().
subviews<Array>.  Other CIViews inside of this view that are updated by this view (their superview).  Defaults to empty Array [].
styleCIStyle.  The style rules for this view.  Defaults to CIView.Style.
resizableBoolean.  Whether this view is affected when the window is resized.  Use with caution as resizing is an expensive operation!  Defaults to false.

setSubviews(newSubviews)

setSubviews: function(newSubviews)

This accessor override ensures subviews is an Array.

Parameters

newSubviewsArray.  The replacement subviews.

Returns

This CIView

addSubview(newSubview)

addSubview: function(newSubview)

Add newSubview to the end of subviews (push)

Parameters

newSubviewCIView.  The subview to add to subviews.

Returns

This CIView

addSubviewToBeginning(newSubview)

addSubviewToBeginning: function(newSubview)

Push newSubview into the beginning of subviews (unshift).

Parameters

newSubviewCIView.  The subview to add to subviews.

Returns

This CIView

setResizable(isResizable)

setResizable: function(isResizable)

This accessor override manages the attachment of the resize event on the window.

Parameters

isResizableBoolean.  Whether this view is affected by window resizing.

Returns

This CIView

_viewResized(superview)

_viewResized: function(superview)

This method may be overriden in CIView subclasses to implement custom resizing logic, though it usually does not need to be.  It calculates the new view size by calling <CIRect.toCssStylesObject> on this view’s frame, updates its Element, then calls _viewResized on its subviews, passing itself as the superview.

Parameters

superviewCIView.  This view’s superview.  The most ancestral view will not receive a superview.

show()

show: function()

Show the CIView’s Element in the window.

Fires

  • CIEvent.Showing
  • CIEvent.Shown

Returns

This CIView

hide()

hide: function()

Hide the CIView’s Element in the window

Fires

  • CIEvent.Hiding
  • CIEvent.Hidden

Returns

This CIView

toggle()

toggle: function()

Toggle the display of the CIView’s Element using CIView.show and CIView.hide

Returns

This CIView

unrender()

unrender: function()

Remove this view’s content from the window.

Fires

CIEvent.Unrendered

Returns

This CIVIew

unrender()

First calls unrender, then draws this view’s content in the window by calling <CIObject.element> on its superviews, passing this view’s Element as the parent Element.

Fires

CIEvent.Unrendered CIEvent.Rendered

Returns

This CIVIew

_objectForViewBaseElement: function(additional)

_objectForViewBaseElement: function(additional)

Get an Object you can use as the HTML attributes Object for the base Element of a CIView.  Includes id, class and styles.  Pass an Object for additional attributes or to override the defaults.  This is a convenience method so you don’t forget to set these attributes when subclassing CIView.

Parameters

additionalObject.  Additional attributes with which to extend the attributes Object.  You can also override the attributes Object using this Object.

Returns

Object

CIView.nextZIndex()

CIView.nextZIndex = function()

Get the next highest z-index.

Returns

Number

CIElement

A wrapper around Mootools’ Element that extends CIView for use within CIP.  Has exact same constructor as Mootools.Element.  Extends CIView.

Properties (none are synthesized)

tagString.  The HTML tag to create.
configObject or Hash.  The HTML configuration.
Summary
Functions
initialize
CIElement.make(tag, html)A shortcut function.
$E(tag, html)A legacy shortcut for the shortcut function CIElement.make

Functions

initialize

initialize: function(tag,
config)

Parameters

tagString.  The HTML tag.
configHash.  The HTML configuration passed to Element

CIElement.make(tag, html)

CIElement.make = function(tag,
html)

A shortcut function.  The same as instantiating a new CIElement with its html property set to html.

Returns

CIElement

Example

new CIElement('p', { html: "Hello World" }) => <p>Hello World</p>
CIElement.make('p', "Hello World") => <p>Hello World</p>
CIElement.make('br') => <br/>

$E(tag, html)

function $E(tag,
html)

A legacy shortcut for the shortcut function CIElement.make

A legacy shortcut for the shortcut function CIElement.make
The base class from which all CIP classes inherit.
A CIRect defines the size, origin, clipping and positioning for an object, usually a CIView.
When an object is about to become visible.
When an object becomes visible
When an object begins to hide.
When an object is hidden from the user
When a view has removed its content.
When a view has laid its content (not structure) out.
